name: Ragnarok
description: Ragnarok (Old Norse Ragnar칬k, 'Fate of the Gods') is the prophesied apocalyptic event in Norse mythology - a cataclysmic series of events including a great battle, natural disasters, and the submersion of the world in water. It culminates in the death of major gods (Odin, Thor, Freyr, Tyr), the destruction of the cosmos, and eventual renewal with a new world rising from the waters.

sources: V칬lusp치 (Prophecy of the Seeress) from the Poetic Edda
historicalContext.recordingPeriod: 13th century Iceland (Snorri Sturluson), preserving much older oral traditions
historicalContext.christianInfluence: Debated whether apocalyptic elements influenced by Christian eschatology

prelude.fimbulwinter: Three successive winters with no summer between - Fimbulvetr (Mighty Winter)
prelude.socialCollapse: Brother fights brother, father against son, all bonds broken
prelude.moralDecay: An axe-age, a sword-age, shields cloven, a wind-age, a wolf-age
prelude.cosmicSigns: Stars vanish from sky, earth shakes, mountains crumble

beastsUnleashed.fenrir: Monstrous wolf Fenrir breaks free from magical binding
beastsUnleashed.jormungandr: World Serpent J칬rmungandr rises from ocean depths, causing tidal waves
beastsUnleashed.surt: Fire giant Surtr marches from Muspelheim with flaming sword
beastsUnleashed.naglfar: Ship made of dead men's nails carries army of dead and frost giants

finalBattle.battlefield: Vigrid - vast plain where final battle occurs
finalBattle.odinVsFenrir: Odin devoured by Fenrir, avenged by son Vidar who tears wolf's jaw apart
finalBattle.thorVsJormungandr: Thor kills World Serpent but dies from its venom after nine steps
finalBattle.freyrVsSurt: Freyr slain by Surtr (having given away his sword for love)
finalBattle.tyrVsGarm: Tyr and hound Garm kill each other
finalBattle.heimdallVsLoki: Heimdall and Loki slay each other

cosmicDestruction.bifrostCollapse: Rainbow bridge Bifrost shatters under weight of giants
cosmicDestruction.yggdrasilShakes: World Tree Yggdrasil trembles but does not fall
cosmicDestruction.surtFire: Surtr's fire engulfs the nine worlds
cosmicDestruction.worldSubmersion: Earth sinks into the sea, stars fall from sky

renewal.earthRises: New earth emerges green and fertile from ocean
renewal.survivingGods: Vidar, Vali, Modi, Magni, Baldr (returns from Hel) rebuild in Idavoll
renewal.humanSurvivors: Lif and Lifthrasir (Life and Eager for Life) emerge from Hoddmimis forest
renewal.newSun: Daughter of Sol becomes new sun
renewal.goldenAge: Halls roofed with gold, fields unsown bearing crops

doomed: Thor - Thunder god, dies from J칬rmungandr's venom
Freyr - Fertility god, slain by Surtr
Tyr - War god, killed by Garm
Heimdall - Watchman, kills and killed by Loki
Loki - Trickster, kills and killed by Heimdall
survivors: Modi and Magni - Thor's sons, inherit Mjolnir
Hodr - Returns from Hel with Baldr
destroyers: Surtr - Fire giant who burns the worlds

theologicalMeaning.wyrdVsFreeWill: Prophecy known but gods prepare anyway - action despite futility
theologicalMeaning.heroicEthos: Courage facing inevitable doom defines Norse warrior ideal
theologicalMeaning.cosmicJustice: Even Loki and evil forces destroyed - balance restored
theologicalMeaning.fertilityReturn: Agricultural renewal themes - winter always yields to spring (eventually)

practicalApplications.warriorEthos: Fight bravely even when defeat is certain - honor in struggle itself
practicalApplications.preparation: Like Odin gathering einherjar, prepare for inevitable challenges
practicalApplications.acceptance: Some things cannot be changed - face destiny with courage
practicalApplications.renewal: After every ending comes new beginning - hope beyond catastrophe

relatedConcepts: Valhalla - Where einherjar train for final battle
Odin - All-Father who seeks to delay Ragnarok
primarySources: V칬lusp치 - Most detailed prophecy of Ragnarok
Baldrs draumar - Dreams of Baldr foretelling doom

It culminates in the death of major gods (Odin, Thor, Freyr, Tyr), the destruction of the cosmos, and eventual renewal with a new world rising from the waters.

sections.title: Description
sections.content: Ragnarok (Old Norse Ragnar칬k, 'Fate of the Gods') is the prophesied apocalyptic event in Norse mythology - a cataclysmic series of events including a great battle, natural disasters, and the submersion of the world in water. It culminates in the death of major gods (Odin, Thor, Freyr, Tyr), the destruction of the cosmos, and eventual renewal with a new world rising from the waters.
